alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 9:27AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Columbia County through 1000 AM CDT... At 926 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Poynette, or 8 miles north of Windsor, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Poynette, Pardeeville, Randolph, Rio, Cambria, Arlington, Wyocena, Otsego, Friesland, and Doylestown. This includes Interstate 39/90/94 between mile markers 116 and 123. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
